newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah stable in range trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah stable in range trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was stable against the dollar in range trading on Wednesday.
Dealers said volume was thin in the morning, with some players seen trying to cash out from spot dollars on the back of relatively expensive tom/next swaps.
One U.S. bank dealer said spot rupiah ended at 2,419 in New York overnight, triggering operators to cash out in Singapore and Jakarta as tom/next was traded at 0.40/0.45 points.
He said operators were worried over prospects of a tightening after the central bank money market policy was neutral on Wednesday.
But dealers said liquidity was not really tight. Overnight money eased down to 11.5 percent from 12.0/13.0 percent.
"The underlying sentiment remains biddish for the dollar despite some early profit-taking after sharp dollar increases on Tuesday," the U.S. bank dealer said.
He said the dollar was expected to hover between 2,417 and 2,418 in the morning.
Spot rupiah was at 2,417.25/17.75 at 0200 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,418.5/19.5. Tomorrow and today rupiah were at 2,416.75/17.25 and 2,416.5/17.0, respectively.
One state bank dealer said the rupiah was engineered down late on Tuesday on liquidity and political factors.
He said the approaching general elections on May 29 would keep the tone biddish on the U.S. currency. However, the rupiah might be supported in the short-term due to month-end factors.
Overnight swap was at 0.4/0.5 points. Another dealer said swap rates inched up slightly following an easing in overnight money, but were sold off later by offshore players.
One-month swaps were at 11.5/12.0, two at 22.5/24.0, three at 34.0/34.5 and six at 71.75/72.75 points.
Bank Indonesia raised its intervention band by one point to 2,403/2,595 and the conversion band at 2,403/2,451 on Tuesday.
